title: Non-text Content
shortExplanation: Provide text alternatives for meaningful images, icons, and controls.

title: Audio-only and Video-only (Prerecorded)
shortExplanation: Provide an alternative for prerecorded audio-only or video-only media.

title: Captions (Prerecorded)
shortExplanation: Provide captions for prerecorded video with audio.

title: Audio Description or Media Alternative (Prerecorded)
shortExplanation: Provide audio description or a full alternative for prerecorded video.

title: Info and Relationships
shortExplanation: Use semantic structure so relationships are programmatically determinable.

title: Meaningful Sequence
shortExplanation: Ensure reading and interaction order matches the intended meaning.

title: Sensory Characteristics
shortExplanation: Do not rely only on shape, size, location, or sound to give instructions.

title: Use of Color
shortExplanation: Do not use color alone to convey information or status.

title: Audio Control
shortExplanation: Let users pause or stop audio that plays automatically longer than 3 seconds.

title: Captions (Live)
shortExplanation: Provide captions for live video with audio.

title: Audio Description (Prerecorded)
shortExplanation: Provide audio description for important visuals in prerecorded video.

title: Orientation
shortExplanation: Support both portrait and landscape unless a specific orientation is essential.

title: Identify Input Purpose
shortExplanation: Use correct autocomplete purposes for common user info fields.

title: Contrast (Minimum)
shortExplanation: Text must have sufficient contrast against its background.

title: Resize Text
shortExplanation: Text must be resizable to 200% without loss of content or function.

title: Images of Text
shortExplanation: Avoid images of text when the same presentation can be done with real text.

title: Reflow
shortExplanation: At 400% zoom, content should not require two-dimensional scrolling.

title: Non-text Contrast
shortExplanation: UI components and graphical objects need sufficient contrast.

title: Text Spacing
shortExplanation: Content must work when users increase line, paragraph, letter, and word spacing.

title: Content on Hover or Focus
shortExplanation: Hover or focus popups must be dismissible, hoverable, and persistent.

title: Keyboard
shortExplanation: All functionality must be operable via keyboard.

title: No Keyboard Trap
shortExplanation: Keyboard focus must not get trapped in any component.

title: Character Key Shortcuts
shortExplanation: Single-character shortcuts must be off, remappable, or require focus.

title: Timing Adjustable
shortExplanation: Users must be able to extend, turn off, or adjust time limits (with exceptions).

title: Pause, Stop, Hide
shortExplanation: Users can pause, stop, or hide moving, blinking, scrolling, or auto-updating content.

title: Three Flashes or Below Threshold
shortExplanation: Do not include content that flashes more than allowed thresholds.

title: Bypass Blocks
shortExplanation: Provide a way to skip repeated blocks of content (like skip links).

title: Page Titled
shortExplanation: Pages must have descriptive titles.

title: Focus Order
shortExplanation: Focus moves in an order that preserves meaning and operability.

title: Link Purpose (In Context)
shortExplanation: Link text (or context) must describe its destination or purpose.

title: Pointer Gestures
shortExplanation: Multi-point or path gestures must have a simple alternative.

title: Pointer Cancellation
shortExplanation: Actions should not trigger unexpectedly on down-event; allow cancel/undo.

title: Label in Name
shortExplanation: Visible labels must match accessible names for speech input users.

title: Motion Actuation
shortExplanation: Functions triggered by device motion must have an alternative and be disableable.

title: Multiple Ways
shortExplanation: Provide more than one way to locate a page (with limited exceptions).

title: Headings and Labels
shortExplanation: Headings and labels must clearly describe topic or purpose.

title: Focus Visible
shortExplanation: Keyboard focus must be clearly visible.

title: Focus Not Obscured (Minimum)
shortExplanation: Focused components must not be completely hidden by other content.

title: Dragging Movements
shortExplanation: If drag is required, provide a non-drag alternative.

title: Target Size (Minimum)
shortExplanation: Clickable targets should be at least 24Ã—24 CSS pixels (with exceptions).

title: Language of Page
shortExplanation: Set the default human language of each page.

title: On Focus
shortExplanation: Focus alone must not cause unexpected context changes.

title: On Input
shortExplanation: Changing a value must not cause unexpected context changes without warning.

title: Consistent Help
shortExplanation: If help is offered, keep it in a consistent location across pages.

title: Error Identification
shortExplanation: Identify input errors in text.

title: Labels or Instructions
shortExplanation: Provide labels or instructions when user input is required.

title: Redundant Entry
shortExplanation: Do not require re-entering information already provided in the same process (with exceptions).

title: Language of Parts
shortExplanation: Mark language changes for passages or phrases when needed.

title: Consistent Navigation
shortExplanation: Keep navigation consistent across pages.

title: Consistent Identification
shortExplanation: Identify components consistently when they have the same function.

title: Error Suggestion
shortExplanation: Suggest fixes for input errors when possible.

title: Error Prevention (Legal, Financial, Data)
shortExplanation: For serious submissions, allow review, confirmation, and/or reversal.

title: Accessible Authentication (Minimum)
shortExplanation: Login must not rely on cognitive tests like puzzles or memory without an alternative.

title: Parsing
shortExplanation: Use well-formed markup so assistive tech can parse content reliably.

title: Name, Role, Value
shortExplanation: UI components expose correct name, role, state, and value to assistive tech.

title: Status Messages
shortExplanation: Announce status changes to assistive tech without moving focus.
